intro: Alsine groenlandica, commonly known as Greenland sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pink flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It typically blooms in late summer, producing clusters of flowers that attract pollinators. Alsine groenlandica is often found in tundra and mountainous areas, playing a role in stabilizing soil in these extreme habitats.
